data.text:
85% of the health ‘advice’ circulating online is wrong. Here are 15 health FACTS (proven to be true) to improve your life: 1. The concept of a ‘detox’ is a scam. 2. Fitness is 30% exercise and 70% diet. 3. The typical Indian diet is protein-deficit. 4. Green tea will not help you lose any weight. 5. Using a microwave is not harmful in any way. 6. No exercises can help you target just belly fat. 7. There is no ‘safe’ limit to alcohol consumption. 8. Starting every day with sugary chai is unhealthy. 9. Sugar substitutes like stevia and aspartame are safe. 10. 99% of people don’t need to consume multivitamins. 11. It's okay to drink water before, during, or after meals. 12. Even passive smoking can damage you heart and lungs. 13. To lose weight, dieting is more important than working out. 14. Consuming more than 1 spoon of ghee / day is bad for you. 15. Sitting for 8 hours + not exercising will reduce your lifespan. I’m a medical doctor, and this knowledge is based on medical research and my opinions. What would you add to this list? #healthandwellness #advice #facts

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗻 ‘𝗹𝗮𝗰𝗸 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻’? Ineffective communication can lead to many misunderstandings or disagreements, too. This can include making mistakes or completing tasks incorrectly, having your feelings hurt, causing arguments, or distancing yourself from others. 12 Time Wasters ⏱️ As we strive to remain competitive in an ever-evolving professional landscape, certain time-wasting activities have become commonplace in our daily routines – often born from longstanding business traditions that may not always align with the needs and efficiencies of contemporary workplaces. The consequences of wasting time at work are far more extensive than just financial implications; they can lead to frustration, disengagement, and even burnout.
